defined_class_definition: Terminal structure of the protonephridia unit, capping the proximal tubules. Flame cells are defined by the ‘filtration weir’, or filtration diaphragm, which consists of closely apposed strands of cytoplasm surrounding a central cilia bundle, and by numerous microvilli between weir and cilia. Positive for acetyated tubulin.
Muscles that are present through the mesenchyme, inclusing dorsal-ventral muscles, intestinal muscles and pharynx muscles.
exact_syn: parenchymal muscle

defined_class_definition: A phagocytic cell closely associated with the temporary embryonic pharynx.
Nonciliated epithelial cells that assemble into protonephridial distal tubules.
exact_syn: distal tubule cell

defined_class_definition: The passageway connecting the genital atrium to the copulatory bursa. Part of the copulatory apparatus. During mating, sperm from a partner is deposited into the bursal canal, where it collects in the copulatory bursa before travelling up the oviducts to the tuba.
Glands surrounding the genital atrium that are required for production of the proteinaceous egg capsule shell and stalk.
exact_syn: shell gland

defined_class_definition: An organ that receives and stores sperm from mating partners.
exact_syn: male antrum

defined_class_definition: Region of the juvenile or adult animal between the posterior end of the cephalic ganglia and the anterior end of the definitive pharynx.
exact_syn: neck | pre-pharyngeal region|pre-pharynx region

defined_class_definition: A fully formed, sexually mature organism. The sexually reproducing Schmidtea mediterranea biotype exists as an obligate cross-fertilizing hermaphrodite.
exact_syn: sexual adult | sexually mature adult

defined_class_definition: Anatomical structure that is an individual member of of Schmidtea mediterranea or any other flatworm of the class Turbellaria.
exact_syn: whole worm | WW | intact animal | intact planarian | whole animal

defined_class_definition: D13-D15. Organogenesis and organ maturation continues. Hatching. Days 13-15 post-egg capsule deposition at 20˚C.
exact_syn: hatchling

defined_class_definition: Non-neuronal, pigmented cells arrayed along the proximal side of the optic cup.
exact_syn: optic cup cell | melanin pigment cell | eye pigment cell | eye pigment cell|eye pigment cup cell|eye pigment producing cell|eye pigmented cell|melanin pigment cell|optic cup cell|photoceptor pigmented cell|pigment cell

defined_class_definition: Fused yolk cells surrounding blastomeres undergoing dispersed cleavage during Stages 1 and 2.
exact_syn: syncytial yolk cell

defined_class_definition: A decussation of the diencephalon where the fibers of the optic nerve cross
exact_syn: optic chiasma | chiasm | optic chiasma | optic chiasmata

defined_class_definition: A plicate and protrusible organ that is the sole point of entry and exit for the Triclad gut. It contains epithelial, muscular, secretory and neuronal cell types.
exact_syn: definitive pharynx

defined_class_definition: Plexus of nerves located in the definitive pharynx comprised of inner and outer wall rings.
exact_syn: nerve ganglia of pharynx | neural plexus of the pharynx|pharyngeal nerve plexus|pharyngeal nerve ring|pharyngeal nervous system|pharyngeal neural plexus|pharynx nerve ring

defined_class_definition: Ring of the pharynx nerve plexus that is proximal to the lumen.
exact_syn: inner pharyngeal nerve ring|inner pharynx nerve ring

defined_class_definition: Ring of the pharynx nerve plexus that is proximal to the exterior surface.
exact_syn: outer pharynx nerve ring | outer pharyngeal nerve ring

defined_class_definition: Epithelia associated with the pharynx organ.
exact_syn: pharyngeal epithelium | pharnyx epidermis | pharyngeal epidermis

defined_class_definition: Heavily ciliated epidermal cells covering the outer surface of the pharynx shaft. These are "insunk" epidermal cells in which the nuclei reside behind the layers of longitudinal and circumferential muscles and the epithelial cell body sends out a ciliated projection to the surface to cover and encase the shaft.
exact_syn: epithelial pharynx lining | outer pharynx epidermis | outer pharyngeal epithelium | outer pharynx epidermis | outer pharyngeal epidermis

defined_class_definition: Heavily ciliated epidermal cells covering the inner surface of the pharynx shaft.
exact_syn: epithelial pharynx lining|epithelium lining the lumen of the pharynx|inner epithelium|inner pharynx epidermis | inner pharyngeal epithelium | inner pharyngeal epidermis | inner pharynx epidermis

defined_class_definition: The epithelial surface lining the interior of the pharynx, facing the lumen.
exact_syn: pharynx lumen epithelial surface | pharynx inner epidermis surface | pharyngeal inner epithelial surface | pharyngeal lumen epithelial surface | pharyngeal inner epidermis surface

defined_class_definition: Epithelial surface covering the outside of the pharynx.
exact_syn: pharynx outer side | pharynx outer epidermis surface | pharyngeal outer epithelial surface | pharyngeal outer epidermis surface

defined_class_definition: An epithelial structure housing the definitive pharynx, connected to the esophagus and mouth.
exact_syn: pharyngeal pouch

defined_class_definition: The surface of the parapharyngeal pouch facing the pharynx.
exact_syn: pharyngeal pouch surface

defined_class_definition: Anatomical space between the definitive pharynx and the epithelial cells comprising parapharyngeal pouch.
exact_syn: pharyngeal pouch cavity | pharnygeal cavity

defined_class_definition: The total musculature within the pharynx.
exact_syn: pharyngeal musculature | pharynx muscle | pharynx musculature

defined_class_definition: Pharynx muscle fibers running anteroposterior (proximal to distal).
exact_syn: pharynx longitudinal muscle fiber | pharyngeal longitudinal muscle fiber | pharyngeal longitudinal muscle cell

defined_class_definition: Pharynx muscle fibers running anteroposterior which lie beneath both the inner circular muscle fibers and the apical, ciliated portion of the epithium lining the lumenal surface.
exact_syn: inner longitudinal muscle layer | pharynx inner longitudinal muscle fiber | pharyngeal inner longitudinal muscle cell | pharyngeal inner longitudinal muscle fiber

defined_class_definition: Pharynx muscle fibers running anteroposterior which lie just underneath the apical, cilaited portion of the outer epithelium.
exact_syn: pharynx outer longitudinal muscle fiber | pharyngeal outer longitudinal muscle fiber | pharyngeal outer longitudinal muscle cell

defined_class_definition: Pharynx muscle fibers running parallel to the diameter of the pharynx.
exact_syn: pharynx circular muscle cell | pharynx circular muscle fiber | pharyngeal circular muscle cell

defined_class_definition: Pharynx muscle fiber that runs circumferentially about the pharynx and lies just beneath the inner logitudinal pharynx muscle fibers.
exact_syn: inner circular muscle layer | pharynx inner circular muscle fiber | pharyngeal inner circular muscle cell | pharyngeal inner circular muscle fiber

defined_class_definition: Pharynx muscle fibers thar run circumferentially about the pharynx and lie just beneath the outer longitudinal pharynx muscles.
exact_syn: outer circular muscle layer | pharynx outer circular muscle fiber | pharyngeal outer circular muscle cell | pharyneal outer circular muscle fiber

defined_class_definition: Pharynx muscle fibers that run radially, connecting the outer muscle fibers and epithelia with their inner counterparts.
exact_syn: pharynx radial muscle fiber | pharyngeal radial muscle cell | pharyngeal radial muscle fiber | radial muscle fiber  | radial muscle cell

OLD_NAME: temporary embryonic pharynx circular muscle fiber
defined_class_name: temporary embryonic pharynx circular muscle cell
edit_entity_label: temporary embryonic pharynx circular muscle cell
defined_class_definition: Differentiated muscle cell present in a circular muscle fiber of the temporary embryonic pharynx.
exact_syn: temporary embryonic pharynx circular muscle fiber

OLD_NAME: temporary embryonic pharynx radial muscle cell
defined_class_name: temporary embryonic pharynx radial muscle cell
edit_entity_label: temporary embryonic pharynx radial muscle cell
defined_class_definition: Differentiated radial muscle cell present in the temporary embryonic pharynx.
exact_syn: temporary embryonic pharynx radial muscle fiber

defined_class_definition: Body wall muscle fibers arrayed around the dorsoventral axis. Upon regeneration, these are thought to be produced de novo in the blastema.
exact_syn: circular muscle fiber

defined_class_definition: Body wall muscle fibers arrayed diagonally along the anteroposterior axis.
exact_syn: diagonal fiber|diagonal muscle|diagonal muscle fiber

defined_class_definition: Body wall muscle fibers arrayed along the anteroposterior axis. Upon regeneration, these muscles are thought to be established from truncated pre-existing fibers.Inner most body wall muscle fibers arrayed along the anteroposterior axis. These fibers are thicker than the outer longitudinal muscle fibers. The pattern of these muscles differs along the dorsoventral axis, with the dorsal arrangement converging at the central zone of the anterior pole. The ventral arrangement is more parallel or may diverge slightly as it approaches the ventral pole.
exact_syn: BW longitudinal fiber|body wall longitudinal fiber|longitudinal fiber|longitudinal muscle|longitudinal muscle cell|longitudinal muscle fiber

defined_class_definition: Inner most body wall muscle fibers arrayed along the anteroposterior axis. These fibers are thicker than the outer longitudinal muscle fibers. The pattern of these muscles differs along the dorsoventral axis, with the dorsal arrangement converging at the central zone of the anterior pole. The ventral arrangement is more parallel or may diverge slightly as it approaches the ventral pole.
exact_syn: inner longitudinal muscle fiber | inner longitudinal muscle layer

defined_class_definition: Body wall muscle fibers arrayed along the anteroposterior axis. Upon regeneration, these muscles are thought to be established from truncated pre-existing fibers.
exact_syn: outer longitudinal muscle layer

defined_class_definition: An anatomical compartment of the deep-superficial axis between the gastrodermal nerve plexus and submuscular nerve plexus.
exact_syn: parenchymal compartment | mesenchyme

defined_class_definition: One of two distinct histochemical classes of gland cells, these can be found throughout the body but primarily form clusters of subepidermal marginal adhesive glands along the dorsalventral border of the animal.
exact_syn: eosinophilic gland cell | erythrophilous gland cell

defined_class_definition: A heterogeneous population of pluripotent, somatic adult stem cells and lineage primed progenitors that are required for maintenance and regeneration of all cell types in planaria, including the germline.
exact_syn: neoblast compartment | ASC|adult somatic stem cell|adult stem cell|pASC|planarian adult stem cell|planarian stem cell|somatic stem cell

defined_class_definition: A piwi-1+, nanos+ cell residing in the ovary that self-renews and give rise to oogonial cells that differentiate into oocytes.
exact_syn: female germ cell|female germline cell|female germline stem cell|oogonial stem cell|ovarian germline stem cell

defined_class_definition: Depicted by field contains hematoxylin and eosin staining section of a asexual adult animal. Cavity of pharynx is indicated by arrows. Scale bar = 250um
exact_syn: cavity of pharynx | pharynx cavity | pharyngeal lumen

defined_class_definition: Anatomical space enclosed by the temporary embryonic pharynx epithelial cells. Lumen through which yolk cells are transported into the embryonic gut cavity.
exact_syn: temporary embryonic pharynx lumen

defined_class_definition: Progenitor neoblasts implicated in the maintenance and regeneration of muscle fibers.
An anatomical space that is surrounded by a digestive tract.
exact_syn: gut cavity | digestive system lumen| lumen of digestive tract
